item.title: Jill add a quote by Victor hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent" -- Victor hugo

item.title: Jill add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "There is, we are aware, a philosophy that denies the infinite. There is also a philosophy, classified as pathologic, that denies the sun; this philosophy is called blindness. To set up a theory that lacks a source of truth is an excellent example of blind assurance. And the odd part of it is the haughty air of superiority and compassion assumed toward the philosophy that sees God, by this philosophy that has to grope its way. It makes one think of a mole exclaiming, "How I pity them with their sun!" There are, we know, illustrious and powerful atheists; with them, the matter is nothing but a question of definitions, and at all events, even if they do not believe in God, they prove God, because they are great minds. We hail, in them, the philosophers, while, at the same time, inexorably disputing their philosophy." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Jill add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The life of the cenobite is a human problem. When we speak of convents, those seats of error but innocence, of mistaken views but good intentions, of ignorance but devotion, of torment but martyrdom, we must nearly always say yes or no...The monastery is a renunciation. Self-sacrifice, even when misdirected, is still self-sacrifice. To assume as duty a strict error has its peculiar grandeur." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Jill add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "A working knowledge of the devil can be very well had from resisting him." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jill add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Children know by instinct that hell is an absence of love, and they can pick out theirs without missing." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jill add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "...what they have to say about themselves makes me think that there is a lot of ill-directed good in them." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jill add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I do not like the raw sound of the human voice in unison unless it is under the discipline of music." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jill add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Doctors always think anybody doing something they aren't is a quack; also they think all patients are idiots." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Jill add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "This is what you know about someone you have to hate: he charges you with his crime and castigates himself in you." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Jill add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It's funny, don't you think, how time seems to do a lot of things? It flies, it tells, and worst of all, it runs out." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Jill add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "The question of whether there exists a Creator and Ruler of the Universe has been answered in the affirmative by some of the highest intellects that have ever existed." -- Charles Darwin

item.title: Jill add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I cannot conceive of a great scientist without this profound faith: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jill add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "Why do some memories live only on your tongue or in your nose? Why do others always stay in your heart?" -- Amy Tan

item.title: Jill add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Jill add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "Nothing like the act of eating for equalizing men. Dying is nothing to it." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Jill add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I became convinced that noncooperation with evil is as much a moral obligation as is cooperation with good." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jill add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Ultimately, a genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus, but a molder of consensus." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jill add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I would rather be a man of conviction than a man of conformity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jill add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Occasionally in life, one develops a conviction so precious and meaningful, that he will stand on it till the end." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jill add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Justice is indivisible, and injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jill add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jill add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Jill add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Love is the only way to grasp another human being in the innermost core of his personality. No one can become fully aware of the very essence of another human being unless he loves him. By his love he is enabled to see the essential traits and features in the beloved person; and even more, he sees that which is potential in him, which is not yet actualized but yet ought to be actualized. Furthermore, by his love, the loving person enables the beloved person to actualize these potentialities. By making him aware of what he can be and of what he should become, he makes these potentialities come true." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Jill add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Happiness cannot be pursued; it must ensue." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Jill add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "It is a peculiarity of man that he can only live by looking to the future." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Jill add a quote by Union General Philip Sheridan
item.description: "If I owned hell and Texas, I'd live in hell and rent out Texas." -- Union General Philip Sheridan

item.title: Jill add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "The crowning experience of all, for the homecoming man, is the wonderful feeling that, after all he has suffered, there is nothing he need fear anymore—except his God." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Jill add a quote by Bonhoeffer
item.description: "Faith without works is not faith at all, but a simple lack of obedience to God" -- Bonhoeffer

item.title: Jill add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "The fearful danger of the present time is that above the cry for authority, we forget that man stands alone before the ultimate authority, and that anyone who lays violent hands on man here, is infringing eternal laws, and taking upon himself superhuman authority, which will eventually crush him." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Jill add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine
